ground_truth: In the middle of the night, a stormy sea lashes a small rocky island. In a lonely building, a stone hut, Mr. and Mrs. Dursley are fast asleep in a big double bed, and in the room below, Dudley is asleep on a sofa while Harry sprawls on the floor in a sleeping bag. He adds some candles and glances at the watch on Dudley's wrist. It's midnight. He blows the candles, and a flash of lightning causes Dudley to wake with a start. The heavy wooden door shudders, and Harry hides in a corner as the Dursleys appear on the stairs, with Vernon waving a shotgun nervously. The door falls into the room, and a huge figure looms in the doorway. He steps inside, tucking his pink umbrella into his coat, and fits the door back into the frame. Hagrid bends the shotgun barrel, which fires into the rafters. Harry steps forward, takes a large cake box from his pocket as Hagrid sits down, and points his umbrella at the fireplace to light the fire, terrifying the Dursleys. Harry puts down the cake and looks at the giant curiously as Hagrid smiles knowingly, takes out a letter with a wax seal, and gives it to Harry, who opens the envelope and reads the green writing. Spotting Dudley scuffing Harry's cake, Hagrid points his umbrella and gives him a curly pig's tail, causing the Dursleys to shriek with horror, but Harry laughs with delight. Hagrid throws open the door and goes out, followed by Harry after hesitating for only a moment. In a busy street in London, Harry reads from a list as Hagrid takes him into the Leaky Cauldron Public House. The Smokey Pub is lit with candles, and Harry looks around at the people dressed in old-fashioned clothes. The barman spots them, and everyone turns and looks, with people shaking Harry's hand. A man in a turban is present as they go out into the backyard, where Hagrid taps his umbrella all around a small metal grill. To Harry's surprise, the bricks in the wall start to move, rearranging themselves to form a doorway. Harry steps through the doorway into a strange new world. Diagon Alley is a narrow, crooked lane hustling with witches and wizards in flowing cloaks and pointed hats. Hagrid towers over them all as they pass tiny shops packed full of fascinating and unusual merchandise, including a selection of wizard's cloaks and hats and a pet shop full of owls and cages. An owl sits on a perch outside the shop, and a bat stretches its wings above Harry's head. A group of children gaze enviously at a sleek broomstick in a shop window, and Harry looks worried as all the clerks in Gringotts Bank are creepy little men with long noses and sharp pointed ears and teeth.

test_cases.description:
In the midst of the deep, dark night, when the stormy sea mercilessly lashes against the rugged and isolated small rocky island, a lonely building stands firm. Within this solitary structure, a humble stone hut, Mr. and Mrs. Dursley are deeply asleep in their large, comfortable double bed, completely unaware of the tumultuous world outside. In the room situated just below, young Dudley is fast asleep on a shabby sofa, with Harry sprawled out on the floor nearby, cocooned in a simple sleeping bag. Harry takes a moment to add a few candles, then glances at the ticking watch secured around Dudley's wrist. The hour strikes midnight. He softly blows out the candles, and at that instant, a sudden flash of lightning illuminates the room, causing Dudley to awaken with a jolt. The heavy wooden door trembles ominously, and Harry quickly retreats to a corner to hide as the Dursleys appear at the top of the stairs, with Vernon unsteadily brandishing a shotgun.

Suddenly, the door crashes down into the room, and a towering figure emerges in the doorway, casting an imposing shadow. He steps inside with an air of confidence, tucking a small pink umbrella securely into his coat, and expertly reattaches the door to its frame. Without hesitation, Hagrid bends the shotgun barrel effortlessly, causing it to fire harmlessly into the rafters. Harry, gaining some courage, steps forward and retrieves a large cake box from his pocket. Hagrid then settles down comfortably, points his trusty umbrella toward the fireplace, and ignites a warm, crackling fire, terrifying the Dursleys who react with visible fear. Setting the cake down, Harry gazes at the giant figure with a mixture of awe and curiosity, as Hagrid smiles with a knowing expression. Hagrid then produces an envelope sealed with wax and hands it to Harry, who eagerly opens it and reads the elegant green writing contained within. As Dudley mischievously scuffs Harry's cake, Hagrid reacts by pointing his umbrella and magically giving Dudley a curly pig's tail, provoking shrieks of horror from the Dursleys, while Harry bursts into laughter, filled with delight. Hagrid strides over to the door, flings it open, and steps outside, followed closely by an eager Harry, who hesitates for barely a moment before joining him.

In the bustling streets of London, Harry pores over a list as he trails Hagrid into the Leaky Cauldron Public House. The smoky atmosphere of the pub is dimly illuminated by flickering candlelight, and Harry looks around in wonder at the patrons dressed in old-fashioned, eccentric clothing. The barman catches sight of them, prompting everyone to turn their attention to Harry, with many stepping forward to enthusiastically shake his hand. Among those present is a man wearing a distinctive turban. As they proceed to the backyard, Hagrid taps his umbrella strategically around a small metal grill. To Harry's utter amazement, the bricks in the wall begin to shift and rearrange themselves, creating a magical doorway that leads into another world. Harry steps through this newfound passageway into the bustling, enchanted world of Diagon Alley. The narrow, crooked lane is teeming with witches and wizards adorned in flowing cloaks and pointed hats galore. Hagrid towers over the bustling crowd as they pass by tiny, charming shops brimming with fascinating and unusual merchandise, including a wide selection of wizard's cloaks and hats, as well as a pet shop full of owls perched in cages. An owl perches quietly outside the shop, while a bat unfurls its wings gracefully above Harry's head. A group of children gaze longingly at a sleek, gleaming broomstick displayed in a shop window. Meanwhile, Harry feels a tinge of apprehension as they approach Gringotts Bank, where all the clerks appear as creepy little men with long, prominent noses, sharp, pointed ears, and teeth that look dangerously sharp.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: In the midst of a sunny desert, a gentle breeze tickles a vast sandy dune. In a crowded tent, a canvas igloo, Mr. and Mrs. Bumblebee are wide awake on a tiny bunk bed, and in the kitchen below, Dudley is napping on a hammock while Harry twirls on the roof in a hammock. He sprinkles some pillows and gazes at the stopwatch on Dudley's ankle. It's noon. He eats the pillows, and a burst of fireworks causes Dudley to jump with a giggle. The paper-thin flap trembles, and Harry dances in a closet as the Bumbles appear in the bushes, with Vernon tossing a broom nervously. The flap floats into the sky, and a tiny giraffe shrinks in the entrance. He slides inside, tucking his purple parasol into his scarf, and ties the flap back onto the branches. Hagrid twists the broom handle, which whistles into the clouds. Harry skips forward, extracts a small pie tin from his shoe as Hagrid stands up, and wiggles his parasol at the igloo to extinguish the lantern, delighting the Bumbles. Harry picks up the pie and watches the giraffe curiously as Hagrid giggles knowingly, pulls out an envelope with a ribbon seal, and presents it to Harry, who unwraps the package and deciphers the blue symbols. Seeing Dudley chewing Harry's pie, Hagrid flips his parasol and gives him a round rabbit's nose, causing the Bumbles to cheer in joy, but Harry sighs with sadness. Hagrid swings open the flap and flies out, shadowed by Harry after pondering for just a second. In a tranquil meadow in Paris, Harry sings from a map as Hagrid draws him into the Crooked Cottage Snack Bar. The Quiet Tavern is dimmed with torches, and Harry peers around at the animals dressed in futuristic suits. The barista notices them, and everyone shuffles and peeks, with animals patting Harry's shoulder. A woman in a bonnet is standing as they slip out into the courtyard, where Hagrid taps his parasol all over a large plastic chimney. To Harry's amazement, the tiles on the ground start to dance, rearranging themselves to create an archway. Harry glides through the archway into a curious old universe. Zigzag Street is a broad, straight canal bustling with chefs and bakers in snug aprons and bowler hats. Hagrid shrinks beneath them all as they glance at oversized warehouses bulging with boring and mundane supplies, including a collection of baker's aprons and hats and a pet aisle crammed with cats and bowls. A cat lounges on a mat outside the aisle, and a dog yawns under Harry's feet. A band of adults glance wistfully at a worn-out skateboard in a warehouse doorway, and Harry feels relieved as all the farmers in Goblins' Stable are giant old women with short ears and blunt square chins and eyes.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: In the dead of night, a storm batters a rocky island where Mr. and Mrs. Dursley sleep in a stone hut. Below them, Dudley sleeps on a sofa while Harry lies on the floor. At midnight, a lightning flash wakes Dudley, and as a massive figure enters, the Dursleys descend the stairs with Vernon nervously holding a shotgun. The figure, Hagrid, bends the gun's barrel, which fires unexpectedly. Harry approaches him, and Hagrid lights the fire with his umbrella, terrifying the Dursleys. After giving Harry a letter, Hagrid retaliates against Dudley by giving him a pig's tail, and Harry laughs. Following Hagrid out, they go to the Leaky Cauldron in London, where people recognize and greet Harry. In the pub's backyard, Hagrid taps a wall with his umbrella, revealing a doorway to Diagon Alley. Harry enters, discovering a bustling lane filled with witches, wizards, and peculiar shops. He watches a group of children eyeing a broomstick and feels anxious inside Gringotts Bank due to its unsettling clerks.
